content: this is the fourth in a series of hats designed during the coronavirus pandemic of 2020 the complete series includes one hat in each colour of the rainbow a symbol representing hope during a dark time in our lives made bearable by the spirit of resilience and fellow feeling of friends neighbours and complete strangers knit in dk yarn the vintage-inspired cloche features a fanned ruffle and lace band this is knit flat then joined into a circle before the stitches are picked up for the main body of the hat and continued in the round instructions are given for 2 sizes to fit medium 22 / 56cm and large 24 / 61cm with about 2 of negative ease the cloche is intended to be a snug fit lying low on the brow as always gauge is crucial to a correct fit *nb like many people my gauge is different when knitting in the round than when knitting flat my gauge for this rowan yarn is 22st to 4 in stocking stitch on 4mm needles when knit flat but 23st to 4 on 4mm needles when knitting in the round * i have experimented with different yarns for this project and have found that a smooth yarn with no noticeable halo and a slight lustre works best for me the rowan purelife knit up beautifully but is now unfortunately discontinued either cloche took 2 x 50g balls but there was only a few yards remaining in the large size
